summary: This is a declaration filed by counsel to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York in support of the Federal Bureau of Prisons' motion for summary judgment in a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times. The declaration explains the basis for withholding records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at the Metropolitan Correctional Center under FOIA Exemption 7(A), citing potential interference with the pending prosecutions of individuals named Noel and Tartaglione.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document concerns records related to his incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. His apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and death are central to the withheld records.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: The individual is a defendant in a pending prosecution (United States v. Noel). The withholding of BOP records is justified to avoid interfering with this trial.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: The individual is a defendant in a separate prosecution (United States v. Tartaglione, No. 16 Cr. 832). His interactions with Epstein in July 2019 are relevant to his case, and records are withheld to protect that proceeding.

persons.name: Kara Christenson
persons.context: Author of a Supplemental Declaration with an updated index of BOP records that is referenced in this filing.

connections.description: Tartaglione's interactions with Epstein in July 2019 have been placed at issue by his defense counsel, suggesting they were incarcerated together at the MCC.
The Noel prosecution appears to involve BOP staff and procedures related to Epstein's incarceration and death, though the exact nature of Noel's role is not specified.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein had an apparent suicide attempt while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Psychological records and a lieutenant's log entry from this date detail the circumstances.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The document references media speculation and theories about his death.

events.title: Filing of Declaration in FOIA Case
events.description: This declaration was filed in the FOIA lawsuit (The New York Times Company v. Federal Bureau of Prisons) to support BOP's motion for summary judgment regarding withheld records.

keyFacts: The Federal Bureau of Prisons is withholding records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration under FOIA Exemption 7(A) to avoid interfering with the pending prosecutions of individuals named Noel and Tartaglione.

Withheld records include inmate count documents, staffing rosters, psychological notes on Epstein, and BOP logs from August 9-10, 2019, which are anticipated to be trial exhibits or witness testimony subjects.

Tartaglione's defense counsel has placed his interactions with Epstein in July 2019 at issue, potentially making records of Epstein's July 23 suicide attempt relevant evidence in Tartaglione's penalty phase.

The government argues premature release of these records could influence witness testimony, enable witnesses to shape their stories, and impair the ability to seat a fair and impartial jury due to extensive media speculation about Epstein's death.
